intro: Pancratium, commonly known as the yellow rain lily, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers, which bloom in late summer or early autumn. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is well-adapted to sandy soils. Pancratium species are known for their ability to thrive in saline environments, making them resilient to harsh coastal conditions. The flowers are often used in ornamental horticulture due to their vibrant color and unique shape.
